website_summaries.verdict: Tops its competitors for its impressive technology, large storage space, and lightweight design. The best e-reader available.
pros: Combines amazing 300-ppi high-resolution display, sleek design, effortless page turn feature, and adjustable built-in light to create a truly top-notch reading experience
It also holds a charge for days and stores thousands of your favourite books
cons: It's a costly model, but considering the quality and features you get, it's an investment that's worth the price

customer_reviews.title: It seems a bit more fragile than the Voyage but I think this is due to the fact that it's thinner
customer_reviews.text: My first Kindke was the Kindle Keyboard, then I bought the Voyage and now this one. I found this one really nice and much more responsive than the Voyage. The transition to this one was really smooth and surprisingly even the vocabulary builder was synchronised! (but you need to download all the books). Nice aluminum body, light, the ability to change the warmth of the light is amazing even if instead a scheduler to change it it was best to have an additional sensor. I hope in the future Amazon will open to drm free audio books as well.
customer_reviews.author: MSZ

customer_reviews.title: If you can afford it buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I was bought this as a gift and it is one of the best things I have been bought, it is the best kindle I have ever owned. Battery life lasts ages, it’s easy to read. Can read it out in the sun, you can adjust the screen warmth and it is easy to hold and is light. Totally in love with it! I love that unlike the fire you don’t get notifications popping up and disturbing you when you’re trying to read, it cannot fit easily into your pocket but that is something that I don’t need anyway ♥️
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: The battery went flat every day and the screen kept turning round
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really like this at all. The battery went flat every day and the screen kept turning round so it was upside down every time I breathed; I then had to keep jiggling it about to get it to turn back. I bought it because it had the audio but didn't realise you had to pay double for the book to use audio. It's clumsier to hold and bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Silver Style

customer_reviews.title: The best e-reader I have used
customer_reviews.text: The best e-reader I have used. I have spent more time reading in the past week than I have in the past year. The Kindle Oasis makes reading much easier. Would highly recommend this e-reader. Also I am surprised about how much content is available on both the Amazon store and also generally online in the MOBI format. I recommend the premium leather cover which is really awesome too.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Potter

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, battery lasts days, not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Kindle Paper White user for years. Made mistake of upgrading to new Oasis. Terrible battery life, terrible wifi connectivity. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Yogi

customer_reviews.title: Serious Glitches.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I don't know whether there is a hardware or software issue with mine. Keeps randomly rebooting, sometimes multiple reboots. Also, I have my books set in grid to show latest books. It keeps pushing books from earlier to the front "page", displacing the latest books. And it keeps randomly changing the amount of "pages" of books I have losing "pages" in the process. Have sent for a replacement so will update.
customer_reviews.author: omaexlibris

customer_reviews.title: Make time to read or you've wasted your money
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed by the Kindle. No glare easy to read and navigate screen. Easy to sign up to subscriptions like the economist. You just need time to read. But the Kindle is the only device you will ever need. Although I'm tempted to ask to connect to email accounts....i must remember that the Kindle is for reading....not communication.
customer_reviews.author: Gary F

customer_reviews.title: A bit of  disappointment considering the cost
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to see if all the hype made this Oasis better than it's predecessor. Well the fact that I find as others have mentioned that I have to manually wake it up is a pain. I hate the fact that when I close the book there is a good chance it will have moved anything from a few pages to a chapter or more either forwards or backwards and I don't want to spend my reading time hunting for the page I last read. Yes the warmth is helpful but I really don't think its worth that extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Thorough Disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: A complete disappointment in every way. Downloading books is hit and miss as to whether it displays the cover page and it has become a chore already. The Oasis crashes quite often which is infuriating to say the least. I regret buying this as my expectations were high and it holds no advantage over my much older Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: RainyDayMan

customer_reviews.title: Lovely New Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot. I was very happy with my old kindle voyage, and was disappointed that it is discontinued. This new kindle oasis seemed the closest match in functionality. I really like the page back and forward buttons, which I can swap round to suit me. There were no colour options, however I always use a case anyway. After a few days of use I am very happy with it. The bigger more square screen is good, and the extra light and shade page options are useful. All in all a very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Libby

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the original Oasis
customer_reviews.text: The original Oasis allowed you to detach the battery/cover leaving you with a wafer thin super-lightweight Kindle that was brilliant to hold. However the battery has now been fully integrated into the Kindle to make it waterproof (who cares!) if you then add the Kindle cover it becomes quite heavy to hold in one hand for a long time, compared to the original Oasis. It’s also much wider than the Paperwhite and original Oasis but a lot of this width is taken up with “dead space” rather than screen. Disappointing and over-priced. Can’t see why it costs so much more than the Paperwhite, which is smaller and lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Msquared

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have had most kindle models over the years and am pretty obsessed with the technology of them. Compared to the first Oasis this feels like an excellent refinement and I think it's a great device. The obvious addition here is the warm light. I am not a fan of reading the screen in 'orange' mode, but, compared to the previous model, you can set the colour temperature of the screen to being a much more neutral hue that's less blue and gives far less eye strain. This means reading in low light is easier and just way more natural. Definitely the best model yet, hoping to hold on to mine for a good while!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B. Park

customer_reviews.title: Superb, easy to use and well-designed device
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Paperwhite. Which I loved. But the Oasis is a totally different experience. So much lighter in your hand. And so comfortable to hold. Really easy to use for extended periods. Have used it on a long haul flight and read for hours. Love the screen and the superb adjustability of the backlight. Very easy to use and very good to read from for extended periods. Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: HP7

customer_reviews.title: The best Kindle yet.
customer_reviews.text: I wondered if the price would be matched by the experience. It is if you take account of the mobile access which is a feature I find extremely useful as I work overseas a great deal. This is my 4th Kindle and it is a joy to use. Very light. I like the buttons for page-turning. Long battery life. And very easy on the eye so you avoid the 'just before bed exposure to screens' which is proven to disturb sleep. I love it! I have one quibble: the touch screen is slow to respond.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B

customer_reviews.title: Buy yourself the paperwhite
customer_reviews.text: I love the premium feel but the screen is letting it down the most, it has ghosting of the previous screen even when you wake the device up after the wallpaper goes you go into a book and see the main menu still there something I never noticed of my previous gen paperwhite. The only other problem I have with it is the front of the device it is not rounded out on the edges so if you read it while lying on your back it digs into you fingers which gets uncomfortable very fast
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: What's Missing?
customer_reviews.text: A Kindle. I bought this for night reading and listening. I might even have used the function of reading and then switching to Audible to listen for a bit. AND YET: in opposition to the Audible incarnation on Android, this one on the Kindle Oasis DOES NOT HAVE A SLEEP TIMER!!! So I have to listen on the android anyway (otherwise you wake up at the end of the story and take hours to find where you were) and could have saved me the expense of a 32 GB hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Infinible

customer_reviews.title: Great quality materials used - but disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as my 4 year old Paper Whites screen got damaged. Nicely made device - but - page turn buttons failed to work after using for 1 hour. Amazon sent a FOC replacement - good service as always. Battery life hopeless - 10 hours at best - my Paper White lasted days. Page colour facility very nice. Other than that really not worth paying more than for a new Paper White. My mistake - don't you make the same one.
customer_reviews.author: MPR

customer_reviews.title: Warning - dodgy lighting
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this kindle as the idea of a warm back light really appealed to me. I love the new shape and the buttons and I adore the warm back light......when it works. My issue is that the light fades and brightens frequently and for no reason. It’s sooooooooooo offputing and ruins the experience for me. I sent the first one back but the second one does the exact same. I didn’t pay almost £300 for this to happen all the time. I may just send it back.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Lardner

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Clearly a premium e-book reader, reflected in the price. I'm happy with battery life but then I don't use Bluetooth, only have WiFi on for syncing and maybe read an hour each time. I imagine using Bluetooth/WiFi more would hit battery life. The only thing I don't like is when I'm holding the Oasis in my left hand it's easy to accidentally switch it off because of where the power button is. Not a major issue though, more an irritation. It's also smaller than I imagined but still very happy with it. Highly recommended if you want the best e-reader available.
customer_reviews.author: NormanG

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is poor
customer_reviews.text: received the replacement Kindle Oasis - however I am very disappointed that not only is the replacement device low on charge - this also doesn't connect to WIFI. You need to either reimburse me fully and compensate me for the inconvenience or should send me a brand new device that is fully updated with the latest software updates. I cannot believe that I have been going back and forth with you for over several weeks. I will be returning both devices tomorrow to your address in FIFE and would appreciate if you can please confirm whether you will be reimbursing me or sending over a new device that will actually work. regards
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t connect to public libraries!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe that the only public libraries you can connect Kindle with are IN THE U.S.A.! I absolutely refuse to pay even more to buy books to read on my new, very expensive, Kindle. Therefore, I shall be reading only and all the ‘free’ ones. I strongly suggest that you get your act together and enable Kindle to connect with libraries elsewhere in the world. In case you hadn’t noticed, there’s a pandemic and libraries are closed, so we have to read ebooks. Disappointed isn’t a strong enough word.
customer_reviews.author: Heppie

customer_reviews.title: Thank heavens I lost my beloved Voyager
customer_reviews.text: This is fearfully expensive and I was very doubtful, but took the plunge, and I am so glad: two and a half weeks pension but a great source of pleasure. It will not turn horizontal, but the light weight is so well balanced for me, that I don't miss that. Page turning is very rapid and gentle. I got the amazon suede cover (another big dip into my pension) and the design of that is very comfortable in my hand. I found a good idea to create a slip cover from the box, and it will be - well-nigh - impossible to lose. Altogether contented, if impoverished.
customer_reviews.author: mirobola

customer_reviews.title: Frustratingly takes ages to upload even small files
customer_reviews.text: This Oasis is my most expensive Kindle, and most frustrating. I love its look. I love reading from it. But nothing ever uploads quickly. I have literally waited two days for one book. And I have a habit of sending my own Word docs to myself -- what used to take seconds can now take hours ... even for really small files ... Is my Kindle broken... or do others have similar experiences?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My first Kindle and I love it
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked the feel of a book and steered away from buying one of these. However, after doing a bit of research I decided to go top of the range with the Oasis. Very, very expensive really, as is the cover for it, but so far so good. I like the feel of it (with the cover on), the size, the various options on it and it came with battery life that is still doing really well. I wanted the 4G option so I could take it out with me, which adds expense to this version of the Oasis, but worth it if you want to use it without Wi Fi.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Susan A Barry

customer_reviews.title: slightly bigger and better than old oasis that was already very good
customer_reviews.text: All seems good to me. Slightly bigger screen than old oasis, no faffing about with the charging cover, reading light tone better, faster processor , and big enough to store my audio books, and happier reading in bath knowing its waterproof ! Only down side is that I wish it could sync read audio books like the iPad app, rather than just doing one or the other, but its a small thing I love reading and for the this kindle is magic really (although I understand its expensive in terms of pure functionality compared with an iPad mini etc)
customer_reviews.author: G. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Warm light for nighttime reading, recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Kindle, perfect for nighttime reading with warm light option. Very easy to hold and looks smart.
customer_reviews.author: Martins on the Moor

customer_reviews.title: Not value for money
customer_reviews.text: I’m puzzled as to why I bought this kindle as it’s certainly not value for money. The screen has a very tiny border which means when you hold the book with a hand either side you will invariably turn the page by mistake when you touch the screen. Holding the book is less comfortable than my kindle white.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Kinda a let down compared to the android app..
customer_reviews.text: Shoud be Usb-c Shoud allow USB-C headphones for audible. Should allow immersion reading with audible like the app for android. At this price it should have more features than the android app but it dosnt. Bought one for me and one for my wife. I'm finding I use the android app more than the oasis sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Romantic Husband

customer_reviews.title: Finally, the perfect E Reader.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned various kindles throughout the years but have always wished they had the warm light feature for reading at night. For that reason I would read on a Kindle during my commute and a kobo whilst in bed. Unfortunately kobo books are more expensive to purchase and their store interface is more fussy than Amazon's. The Oasis is lightweight and easy to hold. The battery life is great. The screen is perfect and has an even light distribution throughout. And best of all the warm light is soothing on my eyes whilst reading in the dark. Finally, a perfect e reader. Five stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: @redhaired40

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely excellent
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a couple of Kindles, starting with the Voyage and then the Oasis Gen 2. Various members of my family have had different generations of Paperwhites. This is by far the best of the lot. As others have noted the device is very responsive, page refreshes being particularly quick. But it is the front light that is the star. The warm light makes reading in the dark or low light an absolute pleasure. I can’t comment on the battery life at present. Downloading books seems considerably smoother too. Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Eamonn O'Toole

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Having cracked the screen on my previous Paperwhite, I decided to treat myself to an Oasis. After two weeks of use, I must confess to being slightly disappointed. Whilst it looks very elegant, the device has thus far demonstrated a somewhat skittish nature, which is disappointing considering its cost. My first gripe is the fact that it simply refuses to pair with my Beat headphones. Although I am not a massive fan of audio books, it would be great to have the option to listen to them. Problem two concerns battery life: this is nothing like as robust as is promised by the marketing. If it does not show an improvement on this charge, I will return my Oasis.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: The best just got better
customer_reviews.text: I tended to think the latest kindle reader was just another e-reader. How wrong I was! The Oasis is brilliant to hold, and so light The buttons for page turning make for smooth reading. I like the 'page warming' feature - often I find black print on a white background too glaring for me. Not sure about the battery life though - it went from 100% to about 30% in 3 days. But I was reading most of the time each day. Overall, this is an e-reader and a half!
customer_reviews.author: William J.

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetic and functional perfection!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Keyboard Kindle for years and loved it, but he battery capacity is beginning to fade. My new Oasis is a delight for anyone who appreciates good design. The screen is noticeably better and the excellent touchscreen can be useful for highlighting/lookup: although I sometimes wish it could be "turned off" to prevent inadvertent page-turning—like many, I prefer the buttons. The backlight would be useful if I need it. The one minor criticism, for me, is that the surface of the case is a bit too smooth and "slippy" to hold comfortably and securely. (And maybe the next iteration might have a bluetooth connection to my iPhone to enable audio reading via the iPhone earphones?)
customer_reviews.author: M. Arogyaswamy

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the eye.
customer_reviews.text: The display is very good, wider than my paper white and the much quicker page turns with buttons, makes it a more satisfying user experience. The auto light function is just right and the warm light is gentle on the eye for bedtime reading. I must say the kindle Oasis is a joy to use. So much better than the paper white. For me it's the best. Just wish I had bought one earlier. Highly recommended by this book worm.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to expectations
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this Kindle. I have the first basic Kindle and a Kindle app on my mini iPad so wondered at first if I could justify this purchase. The simple answer is YES. It is light to hold. You can read it in any light. Sunshine to dusk. Even dark. It has a back light that is restful to the eyes I am so happy with the purchase. The only negative comment I can make is that it does not hold its charge as well as advertised. I seem to be charging it every day. I have the super fast charger that does not make it a problem. I would have given it five stars apart from that.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Great product to use general knowledge reading and for study alike
customer_reviews.text: It is great to use a product that does one job - replacing a library - really well! Will I bear to dump my bookshelves? Probably not but I may reduce their number from 5 down to: not sure yet ;-) I have been wondering for some time if the multi-purpose "Swiss army knife" portable device "all functions/apps on one smart phone" is unachievable in a user very friendly package. I hope to hear that it is in time but this device is excellent for reading. I have yet to test the text to speech functionality over bluetooth (using bone conducting headphones of course) performance.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mckee

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! The feel, design and the ease of usage is a MUST HAVE for any reader. I've put dozens of my to-read-list on it and will get through them all ASAP due to it's lightweight feel, it way more comfortable than a book meaning more reading time!
customer_reviews.author: Zaur

customer_reviews.title: Reduces eye strain to nothing when reading for long periods at night
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply the best e reader on the market. Easy to hold fast to download books . Makes reading at night for longer without any eyestrain an absolute pleasure.Charges very quickly from 10%to 100% in 30 minutes .Battery life is excellent reading 2 hours a day and it lasts easily for nearly two weeks. Can't fault this oasis. Other reviews sighting poor battery life lead me to think maybe mine is fluke? Like the interchangeable buttons to turn the page which again is very fast. Given that I have arthritis and wear glasses am disabled in more ways than 1 cannot recommend this oasis more highly especially for us oldies! I am 66!!! Purple Cat 65.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Cat 65

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control for a premium product
customer_reviews.text: Returning my first one due to a couple of quality control issues as seen in the pictures. Minor issue is the scratch marks around the charging port - just looks tacky on a brand new, expensive item. If it was a refurb, or a lot cheaper, I wouldn't care! Much worse though is the bright white dot when using the backlight - hard to photograph, but under the first V in VoiceView in the pic. No way would I accept that in a new device - it's really quite distracting. Possibly a scratch on the underside of the glass as it wouldn't clean away and I could feel nothing there.
customer_reviews.author: ALT

customer_reviews.title: The Oasis needs serious work.
customer_reviews.text: I really hoped I'd like the Kindle Oasis. The fact is it has some major problems. 1- It's difficult getting your own stuff on it. 2-It doesn't support pdfs. 3-The battery life is horrible it eats battery for breakfast. For example I put it down last night with 37% battery, 24hrs later no charge left. The battery is so bad I'm going to see if I can return it. On the plus side the screen is ace, reading is really easy. The user interface needs serious work, really serious work. It's not as straightforward as my Kindle Touch or Fire.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: I take back what I said about electronic books; Oasis 10 is great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Oasis as I was quickly losing my sight due to waiting for an eye operation and the feature of enlarging the text enabled me to continue reading. I have since had my eye operation and continue to use this great piece of kit. For serious scholarly work I continue to use books to make notes, etc. But reading heavy books in bed are nights of the past.
customer_reviews.author: Bulldog Burgess

customer_reviews.title: More like a book!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th kindle, definitely the best and I am thrilled with it ... the page proportions are perfect and who knew that would make such a difference to the reading experience? Also how great to have a page number and not just a location. I love the shape and weight, it is so comfortable to hold. If it smelled like a book and the library covers were in colour it would be absolutely perfect😂 My only gripe would be that there used to be a beautiful leather cover that fitted into the shape of the back and left it part exposed ... I would love these to be available again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Austen

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Kindle Oasis around 3 weeks ago and I love it. I love the touchscreen, I love the screen itself, I love how it looks, I love how easy it is to use, and I absolutley love the battery life. In the 3 weeks I charged it a few days after I first recieved it, and that's it! I'm someone who reads every day for around 30 minutes to 1 hour so this is great for me. I like the amber feature and have noticed it being easier on my eyes at night. Overall this has definitely been a worthy purchase for me, and I recommend it to any book lovers out there.
customer_reviews.author: TheJokerCard

customer_reviews.title: Not for a lefty even turned upside down.
customer_reviews.text: I found this kindle very uncomfortable to use compared to my voyage.i bought it to replace the voyage when it stopped working never thinking that being left handed was a handicap I cannot find acomfortable position to hold it especially with a cover on.The kindle does not seem balanced which makes reading for any length of time uncomfortable. Wish I had spent a lot less money on a refurbished Voyage which was a perfect little machine.
customer_reviews.author: susan halford

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Nice size, god battery, but far too expensive for what it is in my opinion,it managed to freeze within 4 days of ownership, but in the end kept pressing the power button down, managed to get it working again, not that impressed with it, still deciding whether to keep it or not, only must admit paying for it over five months made it easier to own
customer_reviews.author: Chas

customer_reviews.title: I love the large screen
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Kindle Oasis when my old one was unable to take a charge anymore. Whilst I love the features of this, ie the light, screen size etc I really miss the charging cover from the previous Oasis which effectively gave you 200% charge, ie 100% on actual Kindle and 100% on cover. However this new, updated Oasis doesn’t have this feature furthermore the older version with charging cover is no longer available. Having said all that I soon got used to the bigger Oasis and just have to remind myself that it needs charged a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Roywin

customer_reviews.title: The adjustment of the light type is a game changer
customer_reviews.text: As one with dyslexia, reading for any length of time can be difficult. The Kindle helps by having open dyslexia as one of the fonts. This specific model also has the option of adjusting not just the brightness of the light, but also the type of lighting, which helps to keep the words still on the page - something that affects a number of dyslexics. This also when reading for longer periods of time. It is comfortable to hold, and the screen rotation is another help when changing hands. It costs a lot more, but I'm pleased that I went for it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it I guess
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my new toy. I haven't explored all the features, but I'm loving the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Morpheus

customer_reviews.title: Great screen and Whispersync is a great bonus.
customer_reviews.text: I was debating whether to buy the more expensive Kindle and decided yes in the end. I am glad I did. A vast improvement on my last Kindle bought in 2014. The screen view is excellent, especially in the sun. Easy to hold and good battery life. But I read a lot on holiday so the 30 mins a day last 6 weeks figure is not accurate. A feature that is excellent is Whispersync with Audible.
customer_reviews.author: M Broders

customer_reviews.title: Great device with v poor battery
customer_reviews.text: First device drained 10-15% in 30 mins on airplane mode so returned for replacement. Second device is slightly better, but the claim of getting 6 weeks at 30 mins per day on airplane mode and medium light is way off. With regular reading at 45 mins per day give or take, I'm out of battery in less than 10 days, which is v disappointing on long trips where I don't want to have to charge. Otherwise, it's good!
customer_reviews.author: SB St John

customer_reviews.title: Easy to navigate, and light to hold, love it
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent little device, I have got the 6" kindle and I wouldn't have thought that the extra 1 inch would make a difference but it does and it is also lighter than my smaller one, haven't got it wet yet but I suppose it will happen ... And the warmth feature is kind to your eyes no bright glare as before. Absolutely love it the two buttons on the side make for turning pages easier than swiping as your thumb is naturally there holding the kindle. Love, love, love it. Also love the fact that you can play audio books on here too.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Cecil

customer_reviews.title: It is better than my Paperwhite. A delight to use
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think improvements were possible. I bought the Oasis because it was lighter than my paperwhite but it is better in other ways too. The reading options in font, warmth, paragraphing etc are all an advantage to ageing sight. I like the button page turning too. I keep forgetting how the Library and other functi9ns work but it is small enough to figure out eventually. On a tablet it would take me ages. It wasn’t cheap, but the purchase plan put it within reach and I am delighted I bought one.
customer_reviews.author: PJH

customer_reviews.title: The best Kindle yet
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this kindle. It's the best one I've owned so far. I love my Paperwhite but the new Oasis is just that slight bit better. I think the size of it really makes a difference. Just feels so much easier to use and the screen is clearer. The Oasis doesn't have the delay when pressing the screen which previous models have had. Will always buy this model in future. Can I have another one? Haha
customer_reviews.author: Booklover

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, this is my second oasis and it’s definitely different from my first one, but I love the improvements. It’s just as easy to use, the warm light function is great especially at night stops eye strain. I read a lot and I can exhaust the battery in a day so my kindle takes some hammering , so if this one lasts as long I will be more than happy. All in all a great piece of kit
customer_reviews.author: emsy

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Kindle for years as i’m able to increase the size of lettering and not have to carry bulky books everywhere i travel. However, i was intrigued with the latest Oasis Kindle having started with the Keyboard and then Voyage versions. It was, sadly, a really disappointing experience mainly because of the battery being so poor. It says that it lasts for approx 21 hours but mine was more like 8 hours which is just not long enough. Sent mine back and i hope that that they improve this feature with the next version to make it an awesome piece of equipment once again.
customer_reviews.author: Vito

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Charging point should by now have changed to type C. Having said that everything is great. So much better than my previous paper white. The change in lighting automatically is a wonderful feature. As I read a lot till late at night, my old one stopped me from sleeping a good night's sleep as the light was bright, with this one I can go to bed and straight to sleep. Even though there is only an inch difference in size it is a great improvement. Yes it is a lot of money, but I haven't regretted the change.
customer_reviews.author: Hms07

customer_reviews.title: not the best hardware, bought it to diversify book
customer_reviews.text: In term of display, screen and body texture, 360 rotation and most hardware thing I found Kobo Forma to be the definite winner, while oasis wins for audiosync (Audible is also more usable than Kobo's, allowing you jump to chapters), and seem to offer more books. So I upgraded from a three-year-old paperwhite. The improvement is mainly in screen size and physical button (holdability), probably not worth the bucks. If you are buying first time I would recommend paperwhite for budget or Kobo Forma for premium.
customer_reviews.author: Yinyin

customer_reviews.title: Method of permanently deleting all unwanted books
customer_reviews.text: It's very good, though a tad weighty for my old hands ! My main reason for just 4 stars is that there seems to be no way to delete (permanently) - I got rid of my old one 2years ago because I had so many unwanted books on it that I didn't wish for anyone else to see ! When I bought the new oasis version I thought I was starting off with a fresh new library - sadly, all the old books have reappeared - and I don't want them ! So how do I get rid of these old books without them ever popping up again ??
customer_reviews.author: billa

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: Great device It's ergonomic and very lightweight The screen is great for reading and the buttons are useful especially for one handed use I highly recommend this product, but i returned it because there was a great deal for a lenovo chromebook duet. This was because of the multi uses of it and the fact that i can read comics on colour. The disappointing thing about the kindle is that it has no USB C but other than that great device, if not for the chromebook deal I would have kept it
customer_reviews.author: Bbm

customer_reviews.title: All of the above
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. My previous Kindle was less than half the price, all colour and I could add music to my library. When the device arrived it had my book library on it but I can’t find my music.
customer_reviews.author: mr m w warrender

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 70th birthday. When I found out the price I nearly died! I do like it but then I loved my Paoerwhite. I don’t like the warm screen I find there is not enough contrast with the writing and what is the point of the buttons on the right when you have a touch screen.
customer_reviews.author: Glynis Margaret Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Not what  I had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Oasis for a stay in hospital. I chose the most expensive option for maximum user flexibility. This was my fourth kindle, replacing a voyage. In particular I was attracted by the opportunity to listen to Audible books on the Oasis. Nothing worked as well as I expected, sound quality, through AirPods pro was jerky and poor, controls and ease of use seemed less user friendly than my voyage. I returned the kindle to Amazon,as usual the returns process was faultless and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: grahamthefez

customer_reviews.title: Easy and seamless reading experience.
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy and effortless this kindle is to use. From the automatic adjustable light and increased reading surface to using the buttons gives this kindle an easy seamless reading experience. I use the warm light at bedtime and absolutely love it for taking the strain and harshness out of reading during the night. From my perspective this has been a great buy and am now reading more than I did when using my previous kindle. Somehow I am able to immerse myself more in the book which is a great experience!
customer_reviews.author: AMAT

customer_reviews.title: The best kindle yet
customer_reviews.text: This is the best kindle that has yet been made. The price is the only down side but bought mine during the black friday sales. Still expensive but if you read a lot it may be worth it to you. The warm light really makes a difference to night reading and it's is puzzling why this has only just appeared on a kindle. Just be warned that the third party cases designed with the previous generation will fir but will not work with the wake / sleep function. The official kindle cases do.
customer_reviews.author: Cimmerian

customer_reviews.title: A very large backward step
customer_reviews.text: Much prefer my old kindle with the querty board had it for 8 years before it sadly gave up a week ago,only time will tell in the new one will last as long,as for the new one the touch screen is way too irratic,its funny to hold especially if you are used to holding your kindle left handed,and the battery life is no where near as long as my old kindle.All in all a very poor replacement for my orginal very good kindle e reader,can only hope they bring the original back a few years down the line as a retro model
customer_reviews.author: RONALD PALMER

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but battery life disappointing
customer_reviews.text: One of the selling points for this Kindle was the battery life, and that it would need less charging. I haven’t found this to be the case, in fact the other day I thought the device was broken but it turned out to be that the battery was completely flat. As I had been given the Kindle for Christmas and it was only the 5th January (and it been put on charge twice since Christmas) I was surprised and a little disappointed. My old Kindle Paperwhite which is now 6 years old holds its charge much better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs software update.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon have still not cured the problem of the buttons jumping mor than one page at a time. I spoke to Amazon 'help' and the lady said "oh! I've never heard of that before, She must work in a call centre on another planet, because the internet has loads of complaints about this, going back to the introduction of the Oasis. The touch screen works flawlessly, but the buttons are wallpaper. Having said that, I love the Oasis, this is the fourth version of Amazon readers i have purchased over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Change the way you read
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ebook reader. I spent years denying myself an electronic device as nothing could ever replace the feel of a real book. My failing eyesight finally forced me into buying an e-reader, and I am soooo grateful I did. This has completely revolutionised how I read as I can adjust the screen colour and font whenever I'm struggling with reading the words. I love the slim design- the touch screen and downloading samples of books I'm interested in reading. It's like holding a piece of magic and advocate to all those book lovers to buy a kindle - but not any old Kindle but the 10th generation.
customer_reviews.author: LovelyPerson

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great
customer_reviews.text: Great screen, although trying to get the screen to turn off completely, rather than just to a ‘screensaver’ is as annoying as the Paperwhite, and probably doesn’t help towards the battery life. Don’t get me wrong, you’ll still get quite a few days use out of it, but it’s certainly not weeks. The ability to listen to Audible books is great, but slightly worryingly, the first one I listened to on it sounded “crackly” even though it sounds fine when played through the Audible app on my phone?
customer_reviews.author: Labs

customer_reviews.title: Nice,but expensive
customer_reviews.text: Waited a long while to purchase this,as it is expensive. I do like it, but the first one arrived and I found it had to be charged every day!Amazon were great and sent a replacement immediately. The new one is not so bad, the battery life is about a week. I think my paperwhite was better in this regard. It feels much heavier too. I do love the buttons and the warm screen is nice. I bought it for the high capacity , in hindsight its not worth the big price hike really.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Great kindle
customer_reviews.text: I really love the gorgeous screen. The addition of warm light is great. My complaint is with the way the casing is designed. It is metal and and somewhat uncomfortable due to the edges that dig into my hand. Still, everything else about this kindle is great. I just wish it had the soft rubber of my old paper white but then again it looks very premium in metal casing. 5* Update I bought Amazon fabric cover, it looks great and feels very comfortable now.
customer_reviews.author: Jackflyer

customer_reviews.title: Pricy, but the best Kindle yet.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Kindle and my daughter has had two, but this is by far the best. It is on the expensive side and I'm not sure I can justify the extra £100 from the next model down. That said, it is lovely to hold, easy to use and comfortable - with a case, you can hold it very much like reading a real book. The range of settings is excellent, option for Audible is good and the large capacity is very handy. Overall I'm very happy with my only slight gripe that the battery is not as long lasting as my previous models. However this one offers a lot more so that is not really surprising
customer_reviews.author: P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: This the Kindle to own
customer_reviews.text: This Kindle is the 4th Kindle I have owned and easily the best. Response to touch is near-instantaneous, just like an iPad or iPhone. It's early days regarding battery life. The adjustable warm light is a big plus for me. The bigger screen is very welcome. As another reviewer has pointed out, the page turn buttons are not 'silent' I have the graphite model which I suspect in time will show signs of wearing. The screen area of the Kindle is quite thin and easy to hold, the 'bulge' allows for a good grip on the 'slippery' metal, I've not attempted change orientation yet. Is it worth the higher cost than other Kindles in the range? Yes
customer_reviews.author: Totley Rover

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof cover and buttons
customer_reviews.text: I like the yellow light for nighttime use. I find it a little tricky to open the waterproof cover, it fits so tight there is little space to get a fingernail in. I find it takes longer to wake up than my old paper white but not ages and it is easy to catch the buttons so that you find yourself accidentally on another page while you are reading. Otherwise it is just as good as my old kindle. I have no time for snobs that reckon they must have a ‘real book’ pah!
customer_reviews.author: Tea

customer_reviews.title: Buy This
customer_reviews.text: As an avid reader I have been a fan of kindle readers since they came out. I loved my kindle voyage, however the kindle oasis jis just superb. Definitely the premium e reader to have. It’s just absolutely fabulous. If you love reading you must do yourself a favour a get this, you won’t regret this I promise. It’s such a joy reading with this. From the warm light to the fast turn of the pages and the sharp screen is amazing. I could go on. I know it’s more expensive, but it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: william cameron

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to dislike this as I had one of the orginal keyboard kindles and was only changing it as the dog broke mine. I reasearched the options and eent with the consensus that this was the best for someone who uses there kindle alot. I have to say I love it, the fact it is a proper screen isn't a problem as you can change the tone which means it doesn't feel like your reading a screen. It is much quicker than my other one and lets me filter my books on the kindle. I turned off the in store bit which was annoying but now that is off all is good and I am back reading away.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer5679547

customer_reviews.title: great quaility kindle
customer_reviews.text: I've had 3 kindles now the 1st touch screen, a paper white and now this. It is so far my favourite. The grip part is very nice and I love the feature of the screen and buttons auto reversing if you rotate/flip the kindle. The battery life is fine, it lasts well but I do think it could of been made better as a selling point as it is very important for some people. But don't let this put you off. its lovely to hold and read from, and the choice of screen colour is way easier on the eyes. All in very happy and no hesitation in recommending it.
customer_reviews.author: niko

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: All in all a great, if somewhat expensive, upgrade. The only slightly annoying tging is that the touch screen can be over sensitive and from time to time invokes references etc when what was wanted was a page turn. By no means a deal breaker for anyone contemplating purchasing but something to be aware of until you are used to operating the device and have learnt not to be over heavy handed (fingered) when wishing to turn a page. Would advise buying the official case to maximise the easiness of holding.
customer_reviews.author: Nutkin

customer_reviews.title: Why doesn't the old quick release cover not fit the new Oasis?
customer_reviews.text: The only real issue for me is that the easy remove cover is no longer available, with the back of the kindle not having magnetic properties. Being able to use with and without cover was a great plus with all the Oasis range. The only other thing I was expecting on the brand new Kindle Oasis was type C charging port.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Oasis review
customer_reviews.text: I have had many kindle's and this is the best. One or two niggles though, The metal at the back of the kindle is slippy and cold, got round this by sticking on a skin,(they don't make them for an oasis so I used an Ipad one and trimmed it down. The right edge with the buttons is quite sharp at the corner, making it uncomfortable if you use this edge to hold it. With the screen being flush with the outer edge it you cannot lay it face down or you may scratch the screen. Apart from the above it is a great bit of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs J.

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade from previous model
customer_reviews.text: I had the very similar previous model and was very pleased with it, but the screen developed a small black mark that was very distracting. Amazon very kindly refunded me so I took the opportunity it’s to get the new model with the adjustable colour temperature. It’s a small but worthwhile improvement and makes night time reading more comfortable. I think the battery may be lasting a bit better as well. To be honest I can’t tell much difference between the 3G and the new 4G. My old leather case fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: N_C

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I typically use apps on my phone to read in bed at night and end up being awake most of the night. I think I managed 2 full chapters last night before I fell asleep. Easy to hold and lightweight. love the buttons for turning the pages The only thing I'd change is the fact that the book covers are now in black and white and due to the size of the images I can't quite read them all properly before opening the book
customer_reviews.author: Cayla Kirton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing improvements on the original kindle
customer_reviews.text: I have an original kindle - still working well but the improvements in the new oasis are amazing - clear bright screen, clear writing print, soothing slight yellow page appearance to the eye, extended battery life, more comfortable screen dimensions, a vastly improved pixel density which makes pictures and diagrams stand out - no need for colour with this quality!! If you have an elderly kindle, this upgrade is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Friendly

customer_reviews.title: The best Kindle ever
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Kindle. I had the version 1 and 2 Oasis and this is definitely the best of the lot. If you have version 2 the differences are not really worth the upgrade but the waterproof features and larger screen really do justify the jump from version 1. As a long time kindle fan (kindle keyboard, kindle, kindle paperwhite, kindle oasis 1 etc) this is by far the best ever. I just hope they wait a while before they employ colour e-Ink as I cannot afford another device for a few years
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Burns

customer_reviews.title: Sunshine Difficulties
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am pleased with this, my third Kindle device in a decade. My main reasons for Kindle reading are ease of obtaining new books, convenience for travel, and the ability to read outside eg in the garden or at the beach. Smartphones and tablets are not so readable in the sunshine! But I have found that my Oasis can play up a little after just a short time in the sun - the page turn ceases to operate (either by button or touchscreen) and a warning about overheating sometimes appears. This is a shame as I have really liked the ability to read in sunshine that worked so well on my earlier Kindle devices.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Love the warm light
customer_reviews.text: Love the warm light - once the time is set on the kindle it gradually gets warmer over the evening and night - much better on the eyes when reading in the dark whilst my husband is asleep. It’s more square than previous kindles, still not sure if I prefer my previous kindle shape (lost at an airport), but there isn’t much in it. Once I signed in, it recognised my records and was set up in minutes - all my previous books downloaded - really excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Deborah Duerden

customer_reviews.title: Really easy and non tiring to read.
customer_reviews.text: The type face and the more even light seems to make it easier to read. The fact that you change the orientation is great and the page turn buttons are great when you are eating and reading a the same time as it means that you do not have to use possible greasy fingers on the touch screen. The ability to reduce the blue light is also good. Too early to judge battery life.
customer_reviews.author: ad_winkie

customer_reviews.title: Best Kindle so far!
customer_reviews.text: I love how light and slim this is this is and how you can set it to use warm light which is great for reading at night. I love that the page turn buttons are back and that the screen automatically rotates when you change hands to hold it. I don't like using covers so bought a popsocket to make holding it without a cover much easier. The battery life could be better but then I read a lot more than an average reader. So for the latter I guess it wouldn't be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: DragonRose UK

customer_reviews.title: Difficulty changing countries
customer_reviews.text: The screen and backlight is perfect and I enjoy using my kindle even though it can be a little awkward to hold without a cover even with big hands. It also feels as though one of the buttons is on a slight angle under my thumb although this is not visible. Had to switch Kindle stores because of moving back to Australia and was told by UK customer support that this is not possible for Kindles bought in the UK. Fortunately, the Australian customer service changed it over to their store without problems.
customer_reviews.author: onthemove

customer_reviews.title: Really brilliant, glad I invested to replace my old original Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I bought it with the fabric cover which is excellent and fold back magnetically so it isn't loose and in the way when you're reading. The screen is clear and comfortable on the eyes. It isn't too heavy and actually if you are reading a big book, it is far easier than holding the actual book! It feels like a really solid build quality as well. Only time will tell if it is going to last, but first impressions are that it will. Perhaps wait for a Black Friday or other sale to get a discounted price to make it even better value.
customer_reviews.author: DBu

customer_reviews.title: Best Kindle to Date
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best Kindle to date. I chose the larger 32 GB, Free 4G + Wi-Fi version so that I could take it on holiday and use it anywhere. It is just marvellous and so clear and easy to adjust if you want to. If I could give this 10 stars I would
customer_reviews.author: sci fi fan

customer_reviews.title: Lovely screen.
customer_reviews.text: This has a lovely screen, very clear to read. This Kindle is very thin therefore making it quite difficult to hold even with the raised edge. It's almost essential to use a case. I find it slow to wake up, my previous Kindle was instant. Also find it occasionally goes off after reading for about 5 minutes. I've asked Amazon about this but haven't heard back. Is it worth the extra money from a paperwhite? Probably not.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes, the most advanced kindle yet. But the battery....
customer_reviews.text: The key question for most folk, I suspect is, is this kindle worth the extra expense. The pluses - larger screen is beautiful, the font and backlight really excellent and it does feel like expensive kit. However, my main grievance is the very disappointing battery life. Unless the kindle is in airplane mode, and the light is turned down you can see the battery draining. All in all, it’s worth the upgrade - I just wish the battery was better.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Lovely device. Does what it is supposed to and more
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to hold and easy to use. I love the way I can just think about a book I want and a couple of minutes later I can be reading it, even if I am out and about thanks to the 4G option - it seems like magic! I also love that I can carry hundreds of books around on a device that only weighs a few ounces. I like that it is waterproof. I love to read in the bath but not on an electronic device. Now I can read in the bath without fear. And I like that it works with Audible so I read books or listen to audiobooks on the same device. It makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. M. J. Rimmer

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade and enjoying it...
customer_reviews.text: I have all the Kindle editions - a Kindle nut! I like this one but wish we had the choice of a cover picture and I also wish, one day, colour might be an option and better diagrams and pictures. I don't think this edition has many improvements worth noting over the Paperwhite.. I'm not displeased. But if you have a Paperwhite then maybe you wont find this edition worth splashing the extra cash out for.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Davison

customer_reviews.title: I’m glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated over buying the new Oasis as I had a one year old Paperwhite, but I’m glad I did. I’m really enjoying reading on it and the page turn is much less obvious than with the Paperwhite. One small “grumble” is that the touch screen is very sensitive and sometimes when holding it, my left hand touches the edge of the screen and the page turns. Despite this, I’m very pleased with my purchase and the battery life is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: The Warm Light option is the clincher!
customer_reviews.text: I like the ‘warm’ light option. This for me is the one feature which makes it better than my Kindle Paperwhite which is otherwise better value. If you can afford it get the Oasis for the warm light option. Otherwise the standard Kindle Paperwhite is a great option. Even my old keyboard Kindle is still working after 10 years (I only replaced it to get a backlight but it’s still good for the garden or beach).
customer_reviews.author: Dr P K W Gilfedder

customer_reviews.title: Very light
customer_reviews.text: The side buttons don’t make noise at all I’m very pleased it does dark mode which is why I wanted it My old kindle is much heavier which is ok but of course my 2015 one hasn’t got dark mode I bought mine as a bundle with the amazon leather case in black ok not worth 40 quid but I wanted the gold style not the grey one & at the time that was the one I could get Very pleased anyway
customer_reviews.author: Anne Endicott

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: I have owned just about every Kindle device since the very first. This is far and away the best and in my view it is worth the high price. The reading experience is much, much better than any previous device. The whole thing also responds instantly with none of the “lagginess” found on earlier models. Battery life is as usual nothing like advertised. But it really doesn’t matter as the device charges back up to 100% very quickly indeed. If you use your Kindle at all regularly and can find the price then I would recommend anyone to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: K. J. Hard

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected Gift - What a Delight!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Christmas and couldn’t quite understand why as I was perfectly happy with my paper white one. However, once I got into this one I’d have to say it’s far superior. Both with the backlighting and the rotation. As someone who doesn’t sleep well I do a lot of reading at night, with this device the text turns when I turn over. It is expensive but will (hopefully) be the last kindle I ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Taexali

product_meta.title: Kindle Oasis | Now with adjustable warm light | Waterproof, 8 GB, Wi-Fi | Graphite
feature_bullets: Adjustable warm light allows you to shift screen shade from white to amber.
Waterproof (IPX8) so you can read in the bath or by the pool.
Thin and light ergonomic design with page-turn buttons.
Reads like printed paper with the latest E Ink technology for fast page turns.
Instant access to millions of books, newspapers and audiobooks.
Works with Audible: pair with Bluetooth headphones or speakers to switch seamlessly between reading and listening.
